function.name: Is Protocol Supported
function.description: This function is called by the Tunneling server plugin whenever a Request Tunnel command is received. The application should return TRUE if the protocol is supported and FALSE otherwise.

arg.name: protocolId
arg.description: The identifier of the metering communication protocol for which the tunnel is requested.

arg.name: manufacturerCode
arg.description: The manufacturer code for manufacturer-defined protocols or 0xFFFF in unused.

function.name: Tunnel Opened
function.description: This function is called by the Tunneling server plugin whenever a tunnel is opened. Clients may open tunnels by sending a Request Tunnel command.

arg.name: tunnelId
arg.description: The identifier of the tunnel that has been opened.

arg.name: protocolId
arg.description: The identifier of the metering communication protocol for the tunnel.

arg.name: manufacturerCode
arg.description: The manufacturer code for manufacturer-defined protocols or 0xFFFF in unused.

arg.name: flowControlSupport
arg.description: TRUE is flow control support is requested or FALSE if it is not.

arg.name: maximumIncomingTransferSize
arg.description: The maximum incoming transfer size of the client.

function.name: Data Received
function.description: This function is called by the Tunneling server plugin whenever data is received from a client through a tunnel.

arg.name: tunnelId
arg.description: The identifier of the tunnel through which the data was received.

arg.name: data
arg.description: Buffer containing the raw octets of the data.

arg.name: dataLen
arg.description: The length in octets of the data.

function.name: Data Error
function.description: This function is called by the Tunneling server plugin whenever a data error occurs on a tunnel. Errors occur if a device attempts to send data on tunnel that is no longer active or if the tunneling does not belong to the device.

arg.name: tunnelId
arg.description: The identifier of the tunnel on which this data error occurred.

function.name: Tunnel Closed
function.description: This function is called by the Tunneling server plugin whenever a tunnel is closed. Clients may close tunnels by sending a Close Tunnel command. The server can preemptively close inactive tunnels after a timeout.

arg.name: tunnelId
arg.description: The identifier of the tunnel that has been closed.

arg.name: clientInitiated
arg.description: TRUE if the client initiated the closing of the tunnel or FALSE if the server closed the tunnel due to inactivity.
